meanings.definition: A thin, flat piece of material attached at one edge, used to cover or close an opening.
meanings.sent1: The bird's wing has a colorful flap.
meanings.sent2: She used a flap to keep the dust out of the room.
meanings.sent3: The flap on the envelope got stuck, making it hard to open.
meanings.sent4: The flag waved like a flap in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The noise stopped when the flap closed tightly.

meanings.definition: To move up and down or back and forth quickly and repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The butterfly will flap its wings to fly.
meanings.sent2: He likes to flap his arms when he's excited.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow began to flap in the breeze, scaring the birds away.
meanings.sent4: Her heart started to flap with nervousness before the big test.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the curtains flap noisily in the night.

meanings.definition: A loud, sharp sound made by something striking a surface.
meanings.sent1: The loud flap of the door woke up the baby.
meanings.sent2: The flap of the book hitting the table echoed in the room.
meanings.sent3: The flap of the cards being shuffled filled the room with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The flap of the hammer hitting the nail was music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The sudden flap of the flagpole startled the crowd.
